children.subject: If we applied to this program, when should we expect to hear back?
Since CS 170 is likely canceled in the Spring, should I still apply if I haven't taken it yet?

history.content:
If you expect to have taken CS 170 by Summer 2020 and are interested in going to Ethiopia next summer, you may be interested in what follows ...

AddisCoder (addiscoder.com) is an intensive summer program in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia introducing high schoolers to programming and algorithms. The program is free for participants. Over 500 students have completed the program, and students have generally been very strong.  Alumni have gone on to study at Harvard, MIT, Princeton, Stanford, Cornell, Columbia, Brown, and many other institutions in the U.S., South Korea, Ethiopia, Germany, and the U.A.E. They have also gone on to work both as interns and full-time software engineers at Facebook, Google, Microsoft, Oracle, etc. A few alumni from the first offering of the course are now pursuing their PhDs in CS/math/engineering. In the 2016 and 2018 offerings, top students from every region of the country (Ethiopia's population is over 100 million) were hand-picked by the Ministry of Education to participate in the program. In 2019, there was a mix of MoE-selected students and students who applied directly, and 2020 will be similar.  (See addiscoder.com for program details and blurbs on some alumni).

We are looking for teaching assistants for Summer 2020, and we have funding to cover full expenses for TAs (flight, lodging, and local transportation). The ideal applicant should have taken CS 170 before Summer 2020 and also be passionate about teaching. If you are interested, see http://www.addiscoder.com/#apply to apply. The program will run for 5 weeks from mid July to mid August (exact dates TBD), with the first of the 5 weeks being for setup.

If you have any questions, please e-mail the program's founder Jelani Nelson at minilek@berkeley.edu.
